author: Jeff Wood
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Airport was nice, however very long walk from arrival gate to baggage claim. Ridiculous long wait for bags to arrive on carousel. We flew from Dallas to Cincinnati, the flight was a bit over two hours, it took nearly that long (just under two hours) for our bags to arrive in baggage claim. The person at the baggage desk was not able to provide any information about the status of the bags. We had trackers on them and could see they were sitting at a different terminal for well over 90 minutes after our arrival. Talking to other passengers and the Uber driver, apparently this is very common. We were told the airport is expanding operations, without upgrading infrastructure or adding staff to handle the extra traffic. If you have appointments shortly after you arrive plan on being late.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'July 2023', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Keane
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  At Arrival, it took an excessive amount of time for my luggage to arrive at the claim area. At departure, there was a minimal line (when we got there) at TSA being funnelled into 2 open lanes (2 out of 10!) . The open lane we were put into hardly moved, as all wheelchairs and ClearPass passengers were moved in ahead of the line, rather than having their own independent lane for scanning & baggage check. Then the luggage machine broke, and we stood there for 20 minutes, until one worker finally decided to more the line over to the next machine. It was very hot in this area and after waiting almost 90 minutes to get through I felt nauseous. It was very unorganized and of all the airports I have flown through, never have I had these issues.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'July 2023', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 2, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Thomas Antonio
reviewBody: Not Verified |  It has been 45 and I am still waiting for my bags to arrive! Never have I waited longer than this at any airport in the United States. This is unacceptable!
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2019', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Kemp
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Horrible time waiting for valupark. Busses were non existent. When they did come they packed us in like sardines. They claimed it was due to construction but I had seen 3 fast pass busses before I had seen 1 valupark bus. Then when I inquired upon if they had any extra busses with a airport employee. He stated it was due to work being done. Next time go with fast pass if you don't want to wait.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'May 2019', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 2, 'Food Beverages': 1, 'Airport Shopping': 1, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Beale
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I want to recognize an employee named Karen. I first ran into her while leaving the Thrifty Car rental shuttle & entering the hallway to the ticketing/check in area & she saw that I was crying....she kindly stopped & asked if I was okay...her kindness made my cry more but in a wonderful way, if that could make any sense at all but very true. This sweet girl took my bags & insisted she carry & drag them for me to the check-in, asking if she could do anything to make things better for me or help me in any way, she would. I opened up & she listened, still pulling my luggage & carrying another bag of mine. Who does this?? A super person like her, that's who. Karen went above & beyond in her representation of Cincinnati Airport & I'm hoping whom ever reads this will go the extra mile, as Karen did & find her last name & get this to her manager. It's stories like this that we need to report & in my opinion, as important as a complaint. Please help this get to the correct department so credit is given to this very special employee. Thank you Karen for your kindness.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'October 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Wifi Connectivity': 5, 'Airport Staff': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: James Goodwin
reviewBody: Not Verified |  If you are handicapped and bringing another handicapped person to this airport, make sure you bring someone else to babysit your car while you are getting the other handicapped person into the airport. I am recovering from stage 4 throat cancer and brought my 92 year old mother here for a flight to Phoenix, while taking her in and the car sitting with the handicapped sticker in the windshield, yep they ticketed it after being told by airport personnel to leave it and get her inside it would be ok. But we do understand its all about the money. People do not have a conscious these days, they are greedy here and that is sad.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'November 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 2, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 5, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: H Mitchell
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Why does it take 50 minutes to get bags at the baggage claim for a flight that arrived at 1.05 am? Are they so busy with the one flight that arrived at that time? Absolutely, unacceptable!

author: J Johnson
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I fly from CVG (Cincinnati/NKY International Airport) frequently, for business and pleasure. My airport experiences are typically normal, with few issues, with the exception of the departure traffic attendants. They are extremely rude and unprofessional. They yell and do not give you adequate time to drop someone off and pull out of your parking location. There is no need to be unprofessional and unfriendly. I would not recommend this airport.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 3, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Phillip Kenney
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Beware of navigating this airport by motor vehicle. The signage is not adequate for those unfamiliar with the airport traffic patterns. The worst violation is the sign at the cell phone exit into the airport. The road consists of four lanes, two for arrivals or departures, the other two for commercial vehicles and exiting the airport. The sign for this pattern is overhead at the exit from the cell phone lot so you just have to guess and take your chances. Navigating out and back is sketchy. What were they thinking?
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'June 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Signs': 1, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Kat Stealey
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Airport is nice, security moves pretty fast and it doesn’t get too crazy busy like most airports. The only problem I have had is with the employees that work in the Starbucks near concourse B. They treat their customers with the upmost disrespect, and the store is always filthy. These people chose to work at an airport Starbucks, and get paid to be there but act like every customer is a burden. You guys should really do more research on the employees before you hire them.

author: J Coburn
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Cincinnati was one of the best airports I have ever been to. It was the cleanest airport and the bathrooms were especially clean. The staff were very nice and they very helpful when my flight was cancelled. The concessions there are ok, and they could be better. But the choice of their airlines are just horrible. They have they worst airlines ever. Overall, they are a really nice airport.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'February 2018', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 5, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: B Combs
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  I'm a frequent business traveler that has flown from Cincinnati an average of 3 times per month for the last 4 years. My satisfaction has been slowly declining over the past year. Two things that stand out during this trip are: 1) The line for pre-check was reconfigured recently to make passengers take an unnecessarily long walk in a circle to get to TSA. When multiple passengers did the logical thing and just ducked under the rope, they were scolded by TSA and the TSA agent said "We wish they would reconfigure it too, but you can't duck under". It should not be that hard for airport staff to occasionally check and reconfigure the line to accommodate the current volume of passengers. 2) The only quality food option in concourse B has been Outback, but their quality of service has been declining over the past year as well.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival and Departure', 'Date Visit': 'July 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Seating': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Wifi Connectivity': 4, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: N Dunning
reviewBody: ✅ Verified Review |  Overall, Cincinnati & Northern Kentucky airport provides a pleasant experience and departing is not an issue. However, I have arrived at this airport twice in the past three weeks and an extremely aggravating problem has developed. Once you arrive at baggage claim, wait times to receive your checked luggage are ridiculously long. Today, I only had to wait 45 minutes and felt lucky because 3 weeks ago I waited 1 hour and 15 minutes to get my bag. In both cases luggage from a dozen or so flights were being delivered to a single carousel around which several hundred very annoyed passengers were milling. There were typically gaps of 5 to over 10 minutes between arrival of new "flights" of luggage. I am not sure if this is a staffing problem, incompetence, or negligence, but if this trend continues I would recommend flying in and out of Dayton.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Arrival Only', 'Date Visit': 'April 2017', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Queuing Times': 1, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Terminal Signs': 4, 'Food Beverages': 0, 'Airport Staff': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Kevin Cuello
reviewBody: One of the best airports in the U.S. CVG is an extremely efficient airport with great people, easy to use signs and walkways, and decent food options 1) Check in and Security - It's recommended to arrive no less than 90 minutes before your flight departs. Although it's nowhere as busy as it used to be, sometimes the lines at check-in tend to go longer than most other airports. Going through security here is very fast and efficient. 2) Walkways and trains - The walkways, escalators, and trains are clearly marked and very easy to navigate. It is very hard to get lost in CVG. 3) Concourse A - Concourse A has plenty of space and an abundance of seating. Plugins to charge are easy to find and the seats are comfortable. Restaurant options are varied and you can fond some really good food at good prices. The souvenir options are a bit lacking and are recommended that you purchase before you go to the airport. 4) Cleanliness and restrooms - The airport is extremely clean and has plentiful restrooms which are also clean.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Departure Only', 'Date Visit': 'July 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Terminal Seating': 5, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 3, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Albert Anderson
reviewBody: My flight was terribly delayed in this airport and the staff were actually wondering if we'd ever get out. The worst part is that the airport staff didn't seem to care that we were still there and closed everything down. This isn't fair to stranded travelers. At least keep a bar open for us to congregate. Also, a paid smoking lounge? That's really cheap. Give me a break. Will not be coming through this airport again.
stats: {'Experience At Airport': 'Transit', 'Date Visit': 'July 2015', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 3, 'Terminal Seating': 2, 'Terminal Signs': 5, 'Food Beverages': 2, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Airport Staff': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: E. Baker
reviewBody: This airport has great shopping options. They also have an indoor smoking lounge called Graycliff which is nice. They have tv's with sports games, cocktails, cigars etc. During my connection this past week I left my cell phone in the airport. Within a day and a half the phone was turned in and I was contacted by airport security. The lady there was super friendly and helpful. My phone was shipped out to me immediately. Needless to say I'm very happy with my experience with this airport.

author: Joel Camins
reviewBody: I flew Frontier to Denver this time. The security screening area is new since last, but completely inadequate. Grumpy and pushy TSA agents, and lacking organization. The airport feels if they forgot to turn on the AC on this hot, muggy day in June. What a miserable experience.

author: K Boggs
reviewBody: Airport security employees are the rudest and most grouchy bunch I have encountered. Dining options are very few and far between. But overall wait times are not bad.

author: Kathleen Remner
reviewBody: Terrible walk ways have been broken for more than 8 months. I have flown in or out of this airport 50 times since Sept 2013. United baggage is the worst here leaving baggage unattended and office unmanned with serious delays. Carpeted floors make it difficult to push pull or drag bags. Train has extremely long waits and bathrooms do not have hooks in stalls to keep purses off the floor. With a scale of 1 to 10 with 10 being best I would rate this airport a 2.
stats: {'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jim Porter
reviewBody: I flew on Delta Airlines to MCO and it was a great airport. The terminal was clean and beautiful it really tells about the city's history. The employees were very helpful. The lines for TSA were short and fast. This airport is slightly expensive but it is worth it. I would recommend.
stats: {'Queuing Times': 5, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Airport Shopping': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: J Quinterno
reviewBody: I recently transferred through CVG for the first time in several years. I had forgotten just how easy it is to make connections at this airport especially on Delta flights. The terminal is spacious clean and very well- organized. And the Delta SkyClub is very nice - nicer than many of the clubs at ATL. Unfortunately the service reductions at the airport show as it was extremely empty with relatively few flights showing on the boards.
stats: {'Queuing Times': 4, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 4, 'Airport Shopping': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Michael Rivera
reviewBody: Fast and friendly service. Great terminals tram walkways and food courts. Easy to navigate with lots of information about flights.
stats: {'Queuing Times': 3, 'Terminal Cleanliness': 5, 'Airport Shopping': 5, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: K Van Houw
reviewBody: Terminal 2 is not closed. It looks a bit dated (like it was built in the 70s well it was) but is efficient in serving its purpose. Overall a very easy airport to connect through everything is set up logically. For originating and departing traffic you can get between parking and your gate quickly even at peak departure times. TSA does a much better job here than I've seen at other airports. It's a shame Delta is in the long slow process of de- hubbing it in favor of ATL and DTW but that was inevitable post Northwest merger considering the simple geography of CVG being between the two.
stats: {'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Baughman
reviewBody: CVG has been decimated by the Delta/Northwest merger. Delta has mostly moved out and the airport seems abandoned - much like Pittsburgh. It's a shame to watch this airport build up from nothing return to its modest origins. Delta's Chitauqua Airlines regional jets are now pulling up to Terminal A gates while Delta tries to put ComAir (in dreadful remote Terminal C) out of business. Terminal 2 (Star Alliance) closed altogether and I would not be surprised to see Terminal A mothballed.
stats: {'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Schmidt
reviewBody: CVG is an easy airport if you're not flying Delta. If you are it's still not too bad. Terminal 2 restaurants are not too bad and there is now some food inside security. A big plus. Security at this airport is usually friendly and courteous but I've had my bags screened much pickier at CVG than any other U.S. airport to the point of almost missing a flight for the same bag and contents that caused no problems at other airports. It almost seems like security personnel are bored from few flights and really like to make up for it with those that are going out. Anticipate a little extra time for CVG security. Arriving and departing at Delta terminal 3 is more like getting into any other big airport but terminal 3 food and shops are far more extensive. It's more like a small Atlanta airport but the smaller size makes it less hassle. Arriving at terminal 2 is easy; as there are fewer flights. Unfortunately flights to and from CVG tend to be very overpriced since DL has a near monopoly.
stats: {'Recommended': 'no'}

author: B Luchow
reviewBody: Cincinnati airport is the most wonderful airport I have connected through. The airport's A and B concourses reminded me of ATL but much wider and easier to navigate. Someone told me concourse C is closed but I went there as I had a 5 hour layover and there were several flights. This is a very nice city with a beautiful airport!
stats: {'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Ludewig
reviewBody: Not sure whether they changed the attitude but the custom office at my last immigration process in January was very friendly and even joked about the extended security installations aka handprint etc. I was thru in less than 5 minutes. A very good airport to enter the US. Little strange however is the extended security check right after leaving the customs area when you need to go to your gate for the next leg of the trip. The security there is a lost more restrictive than anywhere in the US not to mention Frankfurt.
stats: {'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Douglas Weir
reviewBody: Immigration and Customs were efficient and I was through both of these plus the secondary security screen in less than an hour in spite of being nowhere near the front of the plane and with another international flight deplaning at the same time. The immigration staff did all that they could to reduce delays by checking forms in the line and correcting them rather than making people go to the back of the line and fill the forms in again and directing people to the US citizen desks once these were empty. This is more than can be said at many east coast airports. The 5 1/2 hour layover passed relatively quickly as the airport had a good variety of shops and the restaurant meals I purchased were surprisingly good when compared to my usual experiences. I'll keep this airport on my shortlist as a transit point.
stats: {'Recommended': 'no'}
